pkgmetadata.longdescription: Metrics for Continuous Efficiency // An implementation of the metrics dief@t and dief@k to measure the diefficiency (or continuous efficiency) of incremental approaches, see Acosta, M., Vidal, M. E., Sure-Vetter, Y. (2017) doi:10.1007/978-3-319-68204-4_1. The metrics dief@t and dief@k allow for measuring the diefficiency during an elapsed time period t or while k answers are produced, respectively. dief@t and dief@k rely on the computation of the area under the curve of answer traces, and thus capturing the answer rate concentration over a time interval.
